result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R. Knott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To begin on or before October 14, 2015 at 6 p.m.  With huber.  Counsel stipulate to 1 day credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Scott R. Knott
Current: S2068 Coon Bluff Rd, Reedsburg, WI 53959 United States  (Effective: 01-13-2016)
Prior: S2068 Coon Bluff Rd, Reedsburg, WI 53959

Defendant Scott R. Knott in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA Harper states that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution calling for dismissal of count 1 for plea to count 2 for max. jail of 90 days, plus statutory costs.  DA states the rationale for her offer.  Def pleads no contest to count 2.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence:  90 days jail, to begin by 6 p.m. tonight.  Court orders costs and DNA sample.

Defendant Scott R. Knott not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Scott R. Knott.  DA states parties are close to resolution; asks for another status.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Scott R. Knott by authorization. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defense requests matter be setover as parties are working toward resolution.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Scott R. Knott in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Charges stated.  NG pleas entered.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
written minutes - $25K signature bond set - no contact with TG
